qas.question: What was the name of Darwin's 35-page writing of his theory?
Which botanist did Darwin begin a correspondence with about his theories?
How many pages had Darwin's sketch grown to in 1844?
What information was Darwin's essay based on?

answers.text: scientific results of the Beagle voyage

qas.question: Who did Darwin write his ideas to in 1842?

context: Darwin continued to research and extensively revise his theory while focusing on his main work of publishing the <a3_0>scientific results of the Beagle voyage<a3_0/>. He tentatively wrote of his ideas to <a4_0>Lyell<a4_0/> in January 1842; then in June he roughed out a 35-page <a0_0>"Pencil Sketch"<a0_0/> of his theory. Darwin began correspondence about his theorising with the botanist <a1_0>Joseph Dalton Hooker<a1_0/> in January 1844, and by July had rounded out his "sketch" into a <a2_0>230-page<a2_0/> "Essay", to be expanded with his research results and published if he died prematurely.
